isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - INSTRUMENTS (New Data Link Driven Instrument Cluster) - TROUBLESHOOTING (INDICATOR AND WARNING LIGHT DIAGNOSTICS) - OIL/WATER

entry.para: Disconnect ECM connector (1091) and use a test jumper to connect pin 5/circuit 97AZ to ground. Move key switch to ignition position. Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Turn key off, reconnect conn. (1091), and turn key on. If warning light does not illuminate during bulb check, reprogram/ replace defective ECM.
Loosen cluster and remove oil/water warning light bulb. Test for continuity.
Re-install bulb. Go to next step.
Replace defective bulb and reconnect connector. Repeat all tests if problem persists. Clear fault codes from ECM.
Disconnect connector (26), and with jumper still attached at connector (1091), measure resistance from connector (26) circuit 97AZ to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97AZ, connector (333), circuit 97AZ, connector (3), or circuit 97AZ, then repair. Reconnect connector and clear fault codes.
Move key switch to ignition position and measure voltage from connector (26) circuit 28E to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 28D or 28E from fuse F1, then repair. Reconnect connectors and clear fault codes.
With jumper still installed at connector (320), reconnect connector (26). Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Test complete. Reconnect connector.
Replace defective cluster assembly. Reconnect connector and clear fault codes.

svcsubproc.title: 2000/4000/8000 Series With Cummins M11E Plus and N14E Plus

table.title: 2000/4000/8000 Series With Cummins M11E Plus and N14E Plus

entry.para: Disconnect ECM connector (320) and use a test jumper to connect pin 1/circuit 97AZ to ground. Move key switch to ignition position. Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Turn key off, reconnect conn. (320), and turn key on. If warning light does not illuminate during bulb check, reprogram/ replace defective ECM.
Loosen cluster and remove oil/water warning light bulb. Test for continuity.
Re-install bulb. Go to next step.
Replace defective bulb and reconnect connector. Repeat all tests if problem persists. Clear fault codes from ECM.
Disconnect connector (26), and with jumper still attached at connector (320), measure resistance from connector (26) circuit 97AZ to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97AZ, connector (333), circuit 97AZ, connector (3), or circuit 97AZ, then repair. Reconnect connector and clear fault codes.
Move key switch to ignition position and measure voltage from connector (26) circuit 28E to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 28D or 28E from fuse F1, then repair. Reconnect connectors and clear fault codes.
With jumper still installed at connector (320), reconnect connector (26). Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Test complete. Reconnect connector.
Replace defective cluster assembly. Reconnect connector and clear fault codes.
Disconnect ECM connector (534) and use a test jumper to connect pin 27/circuit 97AZ to ground. Move key switch to ignition position. Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Turn key off, reconnect conn. (534), and turn key on. If warning light does not illuminate during bulb check, reprogram/ replace defective ECM.
Loosen cluster and remove oil/water warning light bulb. Test for continuity.
Re-install bulb. Go to next step.
Replace defective bulb and reconnect connector. Repeat all tests if problem persists. Clear fault codes from ECM.
Disconnect connector (26), and with jumper still attached at connector (534), measure resistance from connector (26) circuit 97AZ to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97AZ, connector (333), circuit 97AZ, connector (3), or circuit 97AZ, then repair. Reconnect connector and clear fault codes.
Move key switch to ignition position and measure voltage from connector (26) circuit 28E to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 28D or 28E from fuse F1, then repair. Reconnect connectors and clear fault codes.
With jumper still installed at connector (534), reconnect connector (26). Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Reconnect connector.
Replace defective cluster assembly. Reconnect connector and clear fault codes.
Remove warning buzzer at relay socket (R1), move key switch to ignition position, and at relay socket and circuit 29/35, connect a jumper to ground. Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Re-install warning buzzer. To test sensor circuits, go to Step 6.
Loosen cluster and remove oil/water warning light bulb. Test for continuity.
Re-install bulb. Go to next step.
Replace defective bulb and re-install warning buzzer.
Disconnect connector (26), and with jumper still attached at socket (R1), measure resistance from connector (26) circuit 29A/35 to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 29A/35, connector (85)/(84), or circuit 29A/35, then repair.
Move key switch to ignition position and measure voltage from connector (26) circuit 28F to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 28D or 28E, connector (84)/(85), or circuit 28F from fuse F1, then repair.
With jumper still installed at socket (R1), reconnect connector (26). Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Re-install warning buzzer. To test sensor circuits, go to next step.
Replace defective cluster assembly. Re-install warning buzzer.
Disconnect oil pressure sensor connector and install a jumper wire from circuit 35 to ground. Does warning light illuminate?
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 29B/35, connector (2), or circuit 35, then repair. Go to next step.

Disconnect water temperature sensor connector and move jumper from oil pressure sensor connector to between ground and water temperature sensor connector and circuit 29/E29A. Does warning light illuminate?
Circuits check good. Reconnect connectors. If engine has overheated without warning light coming on, replace water temp. sensor.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 29, connector (N/L), or circuit 29/E29A, then repair. Go to next step.
Reconnect oil pressure sensor connector. Does warning light illuminate?
Circuits check good. Turn key switch off and reconnect water temp. sensor.
Disconnect ECM connector (379) and use a test jumper to connect pin 54/circuit 97AG to ground. Move key switch to ignition position. Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Turn key off, reconnect conn. (379), and turn key on. If warning light does not illuminate during bulb check, reprogram/ replace defective ECM.
Loosen cluster and remove oil/water warning light bulb. Test for continuity.
Re-install bulb. Go to next step.
Replace defective bulb and reconnect connector. Repeat all tests if problem persists. Clear fault codes from ECM.
Disconnect connector (26), and with jumper still attached at connector (379), measure resistance from connector (26) circuit 29/35 to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 29/35, 97AF, connector (3), circuit 97AF, or 97AG, then repair. Reconnect connector and clear fault codes.
Move key switch to ignition position and measure voltage from connector (26) circuit 28A to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 28A from fuse F6, then repair. Reconnect connectors and clear fault codes.
With jumper still installed at connector (379), reconnect connector (26). Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Reconnect connector.
Replace defective cluster assembly. Reconnect connector and clear fault codes.
Disconnect ECM connector (379) and use a test jumper to connect pin 54/circuit 97AF to ground. Move key switch to ignition position. Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Turn key off, reconnect conn. (379), and turn key on. If warning light does not illuminate during bulb check, reprogram/ replace defective ECM.
Loosen cluster and remove oil/water warning light bulb. Test for continuity.
Re-install bulb. Go to next step.
Replace defective bulb and reconnect connector. Repeat all tests if problem persists. Clear fault codes from ECM.
Disconnect connector (10), and with jumper still attached at connector (379), measure resistance from connector (10) circuit 29/35 to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 29/35, 97AF, connector (15), or circuit 97AF, then repair. Reconnect connector and clear fault codes.
Move key switch to ignition position and measure voltage from connector (10) circuit 28D to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 28 or 28A from fuse F22, then repair. Reconnect connectors and clear fault codes.
With jumper still installed at connector (379), reconnect connector (10). Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Reconnect connector.
Replace defective cluster assembly. Reconnect connector and clear fault codes.
Disconnect ECM connector (379) and use a test jumper to connect pin 54/circuit 97AF to ground. Move key switch to ignition position. Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Turn key off, reconnect conn. (379), and turn key on. If warning light does not illuminate during bulb check, reprogram/ replace defective ECM.
Loosen cluster and remove oil/water warning light bulb. Test for continuity.
Re-install bulb. Go to next step.
Replace defective bulb and reconnect connector. Repeat all tests if problem persists. Clear fault codes from ECM.
Disconnect connector (12), and with jumper still attached at connector (379), measure resistance from connector (12) circuit 29/35 to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 29/35 or 97AF, then repair. Reconnect connector and clear fault codes.
Move key switch to ignition position and measure voltage from connector (12) circuit 28A to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 28 or 28A from fuse F22, then repair. Reconnect connectors and clear fault codes.
With jumper still installed at connector (379), reconnect connector (12). Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Reconnect connector.
Replace defective cluster assembly. Reconnect connector and clear fault codes.
